sentences.en: But in an old man who has known joys and sorrows, and has achieved whatever work it was in him to do, the fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble.
sentences.cn: 然而老年人已经经历各种欢乐和忧伤, 而且成就了他力所能及的一切工作,就他来讲, 怕死就有些低贱而卑鄙了.

sentences.en: He acquired a slouching gait, and ignoble look.
sentences.cn: 他学了一套萎靡不振的走路样子和一种不体面的神气.

sentences.en: Ignoble fear in the face of danger or pain.
sentences.cn: 他在危险面前总是镇静自若.

sentences.en: Mr. Baldwin was, of course, not moved by any ignoble wish to remain in office.
sentences.cn: 鲍德温先生当然不是出于想继续做官这个卑劣的动机.

sentences.en: Nathan Hale would sooner die a hero than drag out an ignoble existence.
sentences.cn: 内森·黑尔宁愿死得英雄,也不愿苟且偷生.

sentences.en: Some very great men have come from ignoble families.
The fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble.
sentences.cn: 怕死就未免有些可鄙、有些不光彩了.

sentences.en: The self - absorbed love is lofty, while the selfish love is ignoble.
sentences.cn: 爱情的自私是崇高的, 自私的爱情是卑鄙的.

sentences.en: There's something cowardly and ignoble about such an attitude.
sentences.cn: 这种态度有点怯懦可鄙.

sentences.en: To betray a friend is ignoble.
sentences.cn: 背弃朋友是为人所不齿的.

sentences.en: To bettay a friend is ignoble.
Values are ignoble or noble according to one's prejudices and intentions.
sentences.cn: 根据个人的偏见和意图,价值观就分成了卑鄙的或者高尚的.

words.tran_cn: 卑贱地；下流地；不光彩地

trans.tran_cn: 卑鄙的， 可耻的，出身低微的， 地位低下的
trans.tran_en: ignoble thoughts, feelings, or actions are ones that you should feel ashamed or embarrassed about
